9.10 and 10.4 are pretty close. It might work to try doing a grub2 reinstall from 9.10...
is there something special about your hardware you haven't told us about yet? A reason why the autoconfigure would fail?

I'm concerned that if the autoconfig already failed once, it might keep on failing, in which case you may have to do some hand-editing.
so was this an upgrade? Or a from-scratch mythtv system you're trying to put together?

so it used to boot, and suddenly now it doesn't? Do you know what changed?

did you move disks around? That can invalidate a boot config....

back to the 'reinstalling grub2' page for you, then....
the number of kernels shouldn't matter. Most people keep one current and one previous kernel, 'just in case'. Keeping more than 2 takes up disk space but it's otherwise harmless
